name: Coordinating Harm and Promoting Crime
description: Policy prohibiting facilitation, organization, promotion, or admission to certain criminal or harmful activities targeted at people, businesses, property, or animals.
corePrinciple: To prevent and disrupt offline harm and copycat behavior, we prohibit coordinating, threatening, supporting, or admitting to certain harmful activities. We allow debate and advocacy for legality of activities, and drawing attention to witnessed harm without coordinating it.

harmAgainstAnimals.name: Harm Against Animals
harmAgainstAnimals.definition: Apparently intentional infliction of suffering, neglect leading to endangerment, or killing of animals
includes: Infliction of suffering beyond normal discipline (kicking, beating, stabbing, crushing, rough handling)
Neglect leading to endangerment by predator, starvation, dehydration, or abandonment
Killing or death of an animal
excludes: Insects are not considered animals under this policy

allowedContexts.context: Fictional or staged settings (except staged fights/fake rescues)

indicators.indicator1: Written description or visual depiction of apparently intentional physical harm
indicator2: Intent to buy/sell tools for harming animals
Broadcasting Live/Was Live videos of harm
Content posted in profile/page/group dedicated to promoting harm

subcategories.name: Staged Animal Fights
subcategories.definition: Fights between animals organized or encouraged by humans for entertainment (except bullfighting)
activities: Admission to own facility where fight takes place
Trade of animals for fights by brick & mortar entities
Trade of accessories/equipment maximizing injuries (metal claws)
Trade of performance supplements for fighting
Referring to name of animals involved
Posting in profiles/objects dedicated to promotion
Sharing from objects dedicated to promotion
visualIndicators: Taking place on stage, ring, or pit

subcategories.name: Fake Animal Rescues
subcategories.definition: Human intentionally places animal in danger by another animal to rescue it from that situation
primaryIndicators: Incident captured from 2+ different camera angles
Human rescuer appears to discover animal(s) by chance
Rescuer engages predator without animal handling equipment
Rescuer places predator and prey close together
secondaryIndicators: Absence of written or oral explanation for rescue
Absence of professional care after rescue

subcategories.name: Vandalism
subcategories.definition: Deliberate or intentional damage of public or private property by non-owner

allowedContexts.context: Speaking positively about vandalism by others

subcategories.excludes: Threats against property that could lead to death/serious injury (covered under VI)

subcategories.name: Theft
subcategories.definition: Taking property belonging to others without consent (stealing, shoplifting, looting)
activities: Threats of theft, robbing, shoplifting, looting
Offer or request services to commit theft
Intent to buy/sell tools for theft

subcategories.name: Outing
subcategories.definition: Disclosing person's affiliation to an outing-risk group without consent
subcategories.note: Label EVEN IF shared with condemning or awareness-raising context
requirements: Involuntary: exposure without consent (default to involuntary if unknown)
Non-public: information not public or widely known (default to non-public if unknown)

explicit: Mention of name (first, middle, last, full)
implicit: Context from target or Trusted Partner indicating risk
Imagery not depicting face (blurred, from back, digitally obscured)

subcategories.name: Outing Undercover Personnel
subcategories.definition: Exposing undercover status of law enforcement, military, or security personnel
subcategories.requires: Name/face/badge number + any of the following
additionalRequirements: Law enforcement operation (sting operation, gang name)

subcategories.name: Swatting
subcategories.definition: Making hoax call to emergency services to dispatch armed police to particular address

subcategories.name: High-Risk Viral Challenges
subcategories.definition: Activities reasonably likely to cause life-threatening injuries or death
examples: Throwing flammable substances or sharp objects at others
Acts leading to lasting airway blockage
subcategories.note: SSI-specific challenges (Blue Whale) covered under SSI policy

subcategories.name: Mid-Risk Stunts/Challenges
subcategories.definition: Activities likely to lead to physical injury
exhaustiveList: Driving with half body outside vehicle or while standing
Handling or throwing lit flammable substances, explosives, or sharp objects
professionalSettings: Professional solo climbing in national parks

subcategories.name: Communicable Diseases
subcategories.definition: Active and deliberate spread of communicable diseases
subcategories.note: Must be intentional and conscious - not unintentional spread

voterCensusInterference.name: Voter and Census Interference

subcategories.name: Voting Misrepresentation
types: Who can vote or qualifications for voting
Whether a vote will be counted
What information/materials must be provided to vote

subcategories.name: Voter Fraud
types: Offers to buy/sell votes with cash, gifts, services, goods

voterCensusInterference.scope: Elections, official referenda, and official census by national authority

outingRiskGroups.description: Groups where affiliation carries associated risk to personal safety

philippines: Drug dealers and addicts (pusher, user, adik, drug lord, narcos)

mena_political.exception: Official government agency or legitimate news source

religious_conversion.group: Religious conversion, apostasy, atheism, or blasphemy

lideres_sociales.exception: Official government agency or legitimate news source

india: Interfaith couples (private individuals only, except legitimate news)

sex_workers.group: Sex worker or client of sex worker

ethiopia.exception: Elected officials and leaders of political/militant groups

drc.exception: Elected officials and leaders of political/militant groups

glossary.admission: Statement or action acknowledging person engaged in certain conduct (verbal, written, or imagery)
glossary.associate: Person/group participating in commission of acts (helping, omitting to intervene, contributing to network)
glossary.awareness_raising: Sharing information to improve understanding of issue with public interest value
glossary.bestiality: Explicit or implied sexual activity between person(s) and animal(s)
glossary.bullfighting: Spectator sport of human vs. bull physical fight (not bull vs. bull)
glossary.coordination: Organizing future activity including creating events
glossary.crushing: Intentional act of stepping/crushing animal for sexual arousal
glossary.mercy_killing: Killing severely injured/diseased animals to minimize suffering (not self-caused injury)
glossary.pests_vermin: Animals commonly believed harmful to human food sources or carriers of human diseases
glossary.promotion: Speaking positively about, encouraging, or providing instructions for activity
glossary.redemption: Content shared in context of repentance, apology, atonement, or recognition of bad conduct
glossary.staged_animal_fights: Fights between animals organized by humans for entertainment (except bullfighting)
glossary.support: Actions aiding by advocating for, promoting, or providing assistance
glossary.swatting: Hoax call to emergency services to dispatch armed police to address
glossary.threat: Statement/visual representing intention, aspiration, or call for act (intent, call for action, advocating, aspirational, conditional)
glossary.vandalism: Deliberate damage of property by non-owner (excludes threats leading to death/injury)
